unit.utterance: Amurin na katrausi tenatrauswen ni maarik Wili Santo ineu trausi teetwei.
unit.utterance_translation: I want to tell the story of this man Wili Santo, he told it to me long ago.

unit.utterance: Itil natam̃ol ni Ermag inru.
unit.utterance_translation: It tells of two Erromangan people.

unit.utterance: Kaaru ipiatlak nmatu. Selwan ralak ratap mer tao mau.
unit.utterance_translation: One has a wife. When they were married they did not leave again.

unit.utterance: Rato panpan go naliati iskei tenen ipitlak nmatu ipitlak nmatu nega rapan sari.
unit.utterance_translation: They stayed until one day this one with a wife went walking with her.

unit.utterance: Rapan rasoki asler.
unit.utterance_translation: They went to see a friend of theirs.

unit.utterance: Rakaito puserek aslen Ipiatlak wak iskei.
unit.utterance_translation: They talked with his friend. He had a pig.

unit.utterance: Wak nen ipi wak nmatu.
unit.utterance_translation: The pig was a female pig.

unit.utterance: Tenen ipiatlak nmatu itok lek wak nen ito su entan.
unit.utterance_translation: The man who had a wife looked at the pig which was digging the ground.

unit.utterance: Go kinrik kaaru kin na "Alek nmatu gaag, itae weswes wi.
unit.utterance_translation: And he said to the other, "I see your wife knows how to work well.

unit.utterance: Me neu nmatu nigneu itap weswes mau.
unit.utterance_translation: But my wife doesn't work well.

unit.utterance: Tete nrak apestafi itap nrog wou mau. Amurin na kefreg tenen. Anrikin kin me ita pregi mau me nmatu gaag nen itae weswes wi.
unit.utterance_translation: Sometimes I ask her to do this, I tell her but she doesn't do it, but your wife works well.

unit.utterance: If wel ag kuf murin go katuok nmatu neu me ag p̃atao nmatu gaag.
unit.utterance_translation: If you want her, if she wants you, and I'll give you my woman but you give me your woman."

unit.utterance: Go tekaaru nen ipiatlak wak nmatu nen inag, "O iwi top. If wel kin taf tigpielkin ilakor wi.
unit.utterance_translation: And the other who owned the female pig said, "oh very good. If she likes that we make this exchange, it could be good.

unit.utterance: Kineu katuok nmatu neu me ag p̃atao nmatu gaag."
unit.utterance_translation: I will give you my woman, but you will give me your woman."

unit.utterance: Natam̃ol ne ina, "O iwi."
unit.utterance_translation: The man said, "Oh it's good."

unit.utterance: Selwan iplak nmatu ni tekaaru itrapelpel plake pak em̃ae, ipak esum̃ ga.
unit.utterance_translation: When he was with the other's woman he hurried with the woman and they went a long way to his house.

unit.utterance: Me kaaru iplak nmatu ga, nmatu ni wak ne, kaipak esum̃ ga pa.
unit.utterance_translation: But the other one took his woman, the woman pig, and they went to his house.

unit.utterance: Malnen ratigpiel inom. Selwan iplak nmatu nen pan ipan pa teesa ga go inrikin kin na, "E kuipe preg tete nafnag sees takfami me takfo to."
unit.utterance_translation: Then the exchange was finished. When he went with his wife, his child said, "Eh, you've made some food we can eat, and we will stay."

unit.utterance: Wak nen ipan su panpan ipregsaki sernale ni em̃rom.
unit.utterance_translation: The pig dug and made a mess of everything inside the house.

unit.utterance: Maarik nen itok, ito leka panpan. Go kinrus nrogtesakin me ina, "E p̃afreg nafnag takfam, ag kutap nrog nalek, p̃ata freg nafnag mau."
unit.utterance_translation: The man looked for a long time. And he felt bad and said, "Eh, get some food for us to eat, but you don't listen to me, you don't prepare the food.

unit.utterance: P̃aleperkati kafo watgik."
unit.utterance_translation: You look out, I am going to hit you."

unit.utterance: Kutae sup̃ ni teem̃ol itap tae nafte kin marik nen inrikin kin mau.
unit.utterance_translation: You know how animals are, it didn't understand what the man said to it.

unit.utterance: Ipreg namurien ga ipregsaki sernale ni em̃rom go maarik nen kinrogtesaki inrikin kin ina,
unit.utterance_translation: It did what it wanted to and spoiled everything inside and the man felt bad about it and said,

unit.utterance: "If wel kuf to preg teflan pan kafo watgik tete nrak."
unit.utterance_translation: "If you keep doing this then I am going to hit you sometime."

unit.utterance: Go naliati iskei ito panpan go kinrikin kin na kefreg tenmatun kefreg ptaki em̃rom.
unit.utterance_translation: And one day he said she should make something, she should make the place ready.

unit.utterance: Esan iswai. Kefreg ptaki em̃rom, kefreg tete nafnag rakfami. Imal.
unit.utterance_translation: Where she would root around. She should make ready inside the house, she should cook food for them to eat. She doesn't want to.

unit.utterance: Nlaken wak ikano tae nafsan nen kin akit natam̃ol tuto tili
unit.utterance_translation: Because the pig can't know language that we, people, would speak.

unit.utterance: Inrogtesaki wak nmatu nen go kiwatgi ikrakpuni.
unit.utterance_translation: He felt bad about the pig and he hit it and killed it.

unit.utterance: Go ipi nametp̃ag na natrauswen nen atrausi.
unit.utterance_translation: And that is the end of the story I have told.
